alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 23 at 9:58AM MDT until October 24 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 26 possible. * WHERE...Southern Lincoln County. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 4 PM MDT this afternoon. For the Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Strong winds will likely lead to rapid fire growth of any new fire. Blowing dust will reduce visibility to less than a quarter mile in places. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent water pipes from freezing; wrap or drain or allow them to drip slowly.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
